text: Have been comming to Stevens Gap Restaurant for seveal years when we are here on vacation.  The food and service have always been great but this visit was totally different.  The service was horrible and the food was worse.  The best thing was the side salad.  Won't be returning.

text: Great service and amazing breakfast.

name: Dalton Julian
text: Great home cooked typed meal! Been plenty of times and have never been disappointed. Great atmosphere, good staff, and even better food.

name: Randy Bohn
text: Best catfish in the area. Small order was a huge meal. I'll be back

text: Has go kart track and restaurants and place to fuel up. Place to get to lake and camping sites. Just be careful traveling there spring and summer season traffic get heavy and lot of accident

text: Was kinda greasy and funky. Waited 45 minutes for the food. Catfish was greasy and great. Hush puppies so so. Onion rings good.   Not enough staff. Waitress very patient and hard working.

name: Brett Thomas
text: Breakfast was surprisingly good.  Pancakes were delish, as was the breakfast sandwich.  2 pancakes with bacon was more than I could eat.. Bisquits and gravy were good also.  Service was fast and waitress was nice.  Breakfast for 4 was $28..

name: chris graves
text: Food was good, can't beat a chicken fried steak from Texas though. Everything else was great

name: forest maven
text: The exterior remodel looks good. Great place for breakfast.

name: philger mann
text: Great catfish at reasonable prices. Always fresh and served piping hot. The location marker places this restaurant next to the sleepy hollow cabins, it is actually about 1 mile north on the west side of Hwy 259 opposite the Stevens Gap Entrance.

text: Great atmosphere, and food

name: Lynette Hubbard
text: We love this restraunt. It holds about 100. Down home cooking with large portions at a great price. Friendly service. The desserts are handmade and huge. Great variety of pies and cakes for sale by the slice, half, or piece. The fried ‚Ä¶More

text: Good service and good home cooking!

name: killjoy

She was a shorter blonde lady.  She was a BOSS server.  The other girl just looked lost and slow.  If you get the short blonde lady, consider yourself Taken Care Of

text: Service was slow. Potatos were cold. You could see at the window that the breakfast potatos and bacon were sitting there in a stack and when they were ordered they put them on the plate. Not very fresh and chewy bacon. Probably wouldn't go again. So didn't take credit which was inconvenient.
